intro: Derris laotica, commonly known as the Laotian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though some parts of the plant may contain toxic compounds.
